hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Reversal at BEAR to NEUTRAL Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: When transitioning from BEAR to NEUTRAL, if BTC rallies >15% in 3 days on decreasing spot volume (<70% of 20-day average) while perpetual funding remains negative, a sharp pullback to test the breakout level occurs within 4-6 days with 85% retracement probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume bear market rallies often fail due to lack of conviction. Negative funding during rally indicates persistent short positioning waiting for better exits. This creates 'liquidity vacuum' that gets filled when early buyers take profits.
entry_conditions: Previous 10 days in BEAR regime (price < 200-day MA)
Spot volume on rally days <70% of 20-day average
Perpetual funding rate remains negative or <0.005%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price establishes new 3-day high with volume >20-day average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such low-volume bear market rallies continue another >10% without significant retracement
